Accomplishments in the Field: U.S. anthropologist Louise Lamphere has done research among the Navajo on family life. Her ethnography, To Run After Them: The Social and Cultural Bases of Cooperation in a Navajo Community (1977), focuses on the Navajo extended family, kinship and the multiple ways that the Navajo cooperate socially. She has also done extensive research on gender and feminist anthropology and served as President of the American Anthropological Society from 1999-2002. Today, Dr. Lamphere is a professor emeritus at University of New Mexico.
